Rate of fire is the frequency at which a specific weapon can fire or launch its 
projectiles. It is usually measured in rounds per minute (RPM or round/min), or 
rounds per second (RPS or round/s). Several different measurements are used. 
The fastest and most commonly quoted rate is the cyclical rate of fire. ... Typical 
cyclic rates of fire are 600900 RPM for assault rifles, 1,000-1,100...
